intro: Cirrhaea fuscolutea, commonly known as the yellow sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are usually yellow or orange in color, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Cirrhaea fuscolutea is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
